Description:
Detects suspicious malformed user agent strings in proxy logs

Author: Florian Roth (Nextron Systems)
Sigma Repository: [GitHub](https://github.com/SigmaHQ/sigma)
Name: Suspicious User Agent
Query: eql select * from _source_ where (((c-useragent = '_' or c-useragent = 'certutil url agent' or c-useragent = 'mozilla/5.0 (windows nt 10.0; win64; x64; rv:60.0)' or c-useragent = 'mozilla/5.0 (windows nt 6.3; wow64; rv:28.0) gecko/20100101 firefox/28.0' or c-useragent = 'https' or c-useragent = 'erbium-ua-4ce7c27cb4be9d32e333bf032c88235a' or c-useragent = 'x' or c-useragent = 'xxx') or (c-useragent like 'user-agent%' or c-useragent like 'mozilla/3.0 %' or c-useragent like 'mozilla/2.0 %' or c-useragent like 'mozilla/1.0 %' or c-useragent like 'mozilla %' or c-useragent like ' mozilla/%' or c-useragent like 'mozila/%' or c-useragent like 'mozilla/4.0 (compatible; msie 6.0; ms web services client protocol%') or (c-useragent like '% (compatible;msie %' or c-useragent like '%.0;windows nt %' or c-useragent like '%loader%')) and  not (c-useragent = 'mozilla/3.0 * acrobat *' and (cs-host like '%.acrobat.com' or cs-host like '%.adobe.com' or cs-host like '%.adobe.io')))
